title: Stab weapons

properties.name: description
properties.value: Stab weapons are weapons that deal stab-based damage. These weapons are more likely to deal damage to monsters with a specific weakness to stab attacks.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Stab weapons

Stab weapons are weapons that deal stab-based damage. These weapons are more likely to deal damage to monsters with a specific weakness to stab attacks.

Contents

  • 1 Weapons
    • 1.1 Primary
      • 1.1.1 Banners
      • 1.1.2 Pickaxes
      • 1.1.3 Polearms
      • 1.1.4 Spears
      • 1.1.5 Stabbing swords
    • 1.2 Secondary
      • 1.2.1 Bladed staves
      • 1.2.2 Claws
      • 1.2.3 Slashing swords
      • 1.2.4 Spiked weapons
  • 2 Equipment
    • 2.1 Rings
    • 2.2 Capes
    • 2.3 Amulets
    • 2.4 Gloves
    • 2.5 Helmets
  • 3 Best Stab attack bonus
  • 4 Best Stab defence bonus
  • 5 See also

Weapons[edit | edit source]

Primary[edit | edit source]

The majority of attack styles associated with the following weapon types are stab-based.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

Equipment with a positive stab bonus include:

Rings[edit | edit source]

  • Treasonous ring
  • Treasonous ring (i)

Capes[edit | edit source]

  • All versions of the Ardougne cloak
  • Fire cape
  • Infernal cape

Amulets[edit | edit source]

  • Amulet of accuracy
  • Amulet of power
  • Amulet of glory
  • Amulet of fury
  • Amulet of torture

Gloves[edit | edit source]

  • All metal gloves from the Recipe for Disaster quest
  • Combat bracelet
  • Cooking gauntlets
  • Ferocious gloves
  • Regen bracelet

Helmets[edit | edit source]

  • Fighter hat

Best Stab attack bonus[edit | edit source]

Slot Item Stab bonus Notes
Fighter hat +5
Amulet of torture +15 The Amulet of glory gives a +10 bonus, but is significantly cheaper. The amulet of torture requires 75 Hitpoints to wear.
Bandos chestplate +0 Any will work as armour does not provide stab bonus, but Bandos chestplate gives Strength bonus.
Bandos tassets +0 Any will work as armour does not provide stab bonus, but Bandos tassets gives Strength bonus.
Boots of brimstone +3 44 , 70 , 70 , and 70 to equip.
Ardougne cloak 4 +6 Requires completion of the Elite Ardougne achievement diaries.
Avernic defender +30 70 and 70 to equip.
Ferocious gloves +16 Requires 80 and 80 to equip and the completion of Dragon Slayer II.
Treasonous ring (i) +8 The Treasonous ring initially gives +4 stab bonus. However, players can imbue their ring via Nightmare Zone to double the ring's bonuses to +8.
Ghrazi rapier +94 Requires 75 to equip.
TOTAL +176

Best Stab defence bonus[edit | edit source]

Slot Item Stab bonus Notes
Justiciar faceguard +63 Requires 75 to be worn.
Amulet of fury +15
Justiciar chestguard +130 Requires 75 to be worn.
Justiciar legguards +92 Requires 75 to be worn.
Guardian boots +32 Requires 75 to wear.
Infernal cape +12 Requires completion of the Inferno.
Dragonfire shield +75 Requires 75 to equip.
Barrows gloves +12 Barrows gloves may take a while to get as it requires completion of Recipe for Disaster, along with a minimum of 175 Quest points.
Ring of suffering (i) +20 The Ring of suffering initially gives +10 Defence bonus. However, players can imbue their ring via Nightmare Zone to double the ring's bonuses to +20. Requires 75 to wear.
Zamorakian hasta +13 Requires 70 to equip. The Zamorakian spear has the same bonuses, but is two-handed. The hasta requires Barbarian Training and Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.
Dinh's bulwark +145 Requires 75 and to equip.
TOTAL +521 +464 if using the Zamorakian hasta and Dragonfire shield

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Slash weapons
  • Crush weapons
  • Ranged weapons
  • Magic weapons

rawContent:
{{external|rs}}
[[File:Stab style.png|left]]'''Stab weapons''' are [[weapons]] that deal [[Attack types|stab-based damage]]. These weapons are more likely to deal damage to monsters with a specific [[weakness]] to stab attacks.

==Weapons==
===Primary===

The majority of attack styles associated with the following weapon types are stab-based.

====Banners====
{{CombatStyles|Banner}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Banner}}

====Pickaxes====
{{CombatStyles|Pickaxe}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Pickaxe}}

====Polearms====
{{CombatStyles|Polearm}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Polearm}}

====Spears====
{{CombatStyles|Spear}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Spear}}

====Stabbing swords====
{{CombatStyles|Stab Sword}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Stab Sword}}

===Secondary===

The following weapon types have at least one stab-based attack style.

====Bladed staves====
{{CombatStyles|Bladed Staff}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Bladed Staff}}

====Claws====
{{CombatStyles|Claw}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Claw}}

====Slashing swords====
{{CombatStyles|Slash Sword}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Slash Sword}}

====Spiked weapons====
{{CombatStyles|Spiked}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Spiked}}

==Equipment==
Equipment with a positive stab bonus include:

===[[Rings]]===
*[[Treasonous ring]]
*[[Treasonous ring (i)]]

===[[Capes]]===
*All versions of the [[Ardougne cloak]]
*[[Fire cape]]
*[[Infernal cape]]

===[[Amulets]]===
*[[Amulet of accuracy]]
*[[Amulet of power]]
*[[Amulet of glory]]
*[[Amulet of fury]]
*[[Amulet of torture]]

===[[Gloves]]===
*All [[metal gloves]] from the [[Recipe for Disaster]] quest
*[[Combat bracelet]]
*[[Cooking gauntlets]]
*[[Ferocious gloves]]
*[[Regen bracelet]]

===[[Helmets]]===
*[[Fighter hat]]
